title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message: No water damage.

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message: Or maybe I should be asking what causes the pulsing?

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message: CPU Vcore also pulsing? Check if the rest of the rails are pulsing too. I doubt this "just" happened, ask the owner what happened.

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message:
He claims he was using it and seen a wisp of smoke and it stopped working. I see zero evidence of water.

Other3V3, S4_X239, S4_tpad, PP3v3_S5 all pulse. PP3V3_S4 pulses very very low. I think the VCORE was zero.

I see nothing burnt out. Tried new DCIN, and new battery as well.

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message: S5 should certainly not pulse! Is PPBUS stable?

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message:
I get pulsing off of C1845-1 and PPBUS_G3H is stable 12.85-12.87.
On and off pulsing at C8060-1

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message:
PPBUS is too high, did you check on the correct side of the coil or on the fuse?
G2_EN pulsing?

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message:
Have 12.8 on both sides of F7140. G2_EN is pulsing.
L7130 12.8 on both sides.

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message:
12.8 is too high which is strange. Is your multimeter battery low? Check accuracy of the meter, PPBUS should never be higher than 12.58V.
If meter is OK then check sense resistor circuit for ISL6259.

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message: Test Point 37 is 16.83.  Too high. Might be on to something.

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message:
It's Fluke 15B+, I'll try new batteries.
New batteries is the same.

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message: R7110/10 have nothing to do with current sensing......51/52

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message: Oh, I thought it was those.  I also checked R7151 & R7151. They are 2.2 & 0.

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message: S5_PWRGD doing anything?

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message: R8141-1 no pulse, R8142-2 pulsing.

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message: See if the board does anything in SMC bypass mode. Hold power button and connect AC, hold for 5 sec. more and release and press again. PPBUS should come up at 12.23V now.

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message: It is 13.0V at R7005-1.

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message: I have no idea what you are doing, it should be lower in SMC bypass.

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message: Ha, ha. Sorry Duke. I have no idea either. I tried a couple of times. I even read for further directions online. I'll try it again and report back. I know its simple, but have no clue what I'm doing wrong : )

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message: I first tried by shorting C4810, and then assembled and tried that way too. First time I've heard about SMC Bypass. Found some things online about it. Never knew about it.

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message:
With the battery plugged I get 12.86 on F7140-2 after SMC Bypass. Without the battery I get 12.56 and no pulsing at R8141-2. This is a new battery, and same thing with the old battery.
I am doing the SMC Bypass by shorting C4810 with tweezers on each side. I am holding for 10 secs, then I plug in the power cord and wait 5 secs, then I release C4810 and wait 2 secs, then I pinch C4810 for 1 sec and release. Am I doing this wrong?

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message: & this time I experimented by no battery holding C4810 plug in battery then power, wait 10 secs, release, wait 5 secs, then hit C4810 for 1 sec and getting 12.25 at F7140-2.

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message: I do get 5v on the pp5v_s5, I get .218v on pp3v3_s5, and nothing on the s4's.  So I am guessing that I need to check my pp3v3_s5 rails?

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message: Out of ideas on this one besides to check for corrosion or missing components damage.

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message: There was no water damage at all.  The paranoid customer just picked it up, so no worries.  I am taking mental notes and learning something new though : )

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message: I am curious though on what your thoughts are.

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message: No missing components never opened before. I seen nothing burned out.

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message: i have no clue, but I very much doubt it "just" happened. May have been dropped or hit.

title: 1502 820-4924 Pulsing at L7560
message:
Yes, I thought it was very strange because I never seen anything like this in any of Louis's videos.
Once again I thank you for your assistance Duke : )
